channel.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
channel.description:
[img]https://img809.imageshack.us/img809/7303/2012092600011.jpg[/img]
At this point (and a few fail jumps) I switched to always run, it is more like HL. It makes the crouch jumps a lot easier and I don't like this HL2 sprint gameplay as much.
How about you? Always run or HL2 sprinting? And at which point in BM are you switched it? :slight_smile:
PS: sry for the bad grammar and I hope this thread doesn't exist already.[/SIZE]

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
I have always run on because there are a few puzzles that are nearly impossible to get through with out it.

Read full topic

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Parnifia
item.description:
rorriMAesU:

Always run off.

I use right mouse click for run and mouse button 4 for jump. Great control combo. Primary fire, secondary fire, and weapon group 3 quick switch are also controlled by my mouse.

You have 4 mouse buttons?! Dafuq? O_o

Read full topic

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Fryymon
item.description:
Always run since “stealth” isnt affected by movement.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Jenova19
item.description:
Would use both, if I wasn’t so desperately focused on being able to run when I want to and ‘walk’ when I don’t…

Once enabled, I’m always spamming the SHIFT key, at first - only to realise that “…oh right, I enabled Always Run…”.

I’m also using the walk script on ALT, just to admire the scenery. :3

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
Always run off.

I use right mouse click for run and mouse button 4 for jump. Great control combo. Primary fire, secondary fire, and weapon group 3 quick switch are also controlled by my mouse.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Unit24
item.description:
I usually prefer to disable Always Run. It was fine in the original Half-Life, where there was nothing really worth looking at. But in Black Mesa, it seems more appropriate to slow down and appreciate the environment. It feels wrong to just sprint through all of these detailed areas like I’m trying to do a speedrun.

It’s also really irritating on the cliffside in Surface Tension, because it suddenly becomes really easy to fall off.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Parnifia
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

From my experience as a sneaky pyro in TFC, I find that walking is invaluable. It silences your footsteps, like crawling does, but is slightly faster and keeps the top of your skull from meeting a surprised enemy’s rifle.

Wha-huh…? :mono:

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Hell-met:

I for one love the HL1 style. I can actually move around in combat without having to hold down an extra specific key.

I just wish you could walk (using the sprint key with it just isn’t slow enough) like the original.

This was an issue for me, too.

Then I discovered that the sprint-key, in always-run mode, is the same as the walk key. So I rebound and was happy.

Vampire95:

The walking is more calming, and it gets quite annoying to hold shift in HL1 to walk, which is nearly useless unless you’re on tight endges, where I usually just use crouching instead.

From my experience as a sneaky pyro in TFC, I find that walking is invaluable. It silences your footsteps, like crawling does, but is slightly faster and keeps the top of your skull from meeting a surprised enemy’s rifle.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
I tried it on for a few minutes earlier and I just can’t get used to it. I find myself trying to run faster and end up walking slower.

Read full topic

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: jessiestorm88
item.description:
Never turned it on. By the way at that part in the picture you can go to the back wall shown in the back left and stack a box to get up the hole and skip that jumping puzzle and it takes all of five seconds to do.

item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Lance_of_Longinus
item.description:
I have it off, HL2 style feels a bit better for me, constantly running at 50Km/H doesn’t fit well the way I like to explore levels and take my time.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: quadpl
item.description:
I like to play with a ps3 controller so I can throttle my walking speed, and if I want to go on a full out sprint, then I just hold down a shoulder pad. So I prefer the HL2 method.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: warpedfreeman
item.description:
Always run is far better, one of the reasons i never liked to play HL2: DM is beacuse the walk/sprint movement, in the SP fits totally but not in DM.

item.description:
I always run. Otherwise getting across big maps is tedious.

item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: MusicallyInspired
item.description:
Always run. I use walk when I need to be a little slower. Otherwise, I like zooming around. I’m just used to it. I fought a bit with the controls with slipping and jumping too far, but I’m used to that to. I’m not complaining about it. You get what you ask for.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:

I use both. I’m adaptable.

I did my first playthrough with it off. Then after I beat it, I at some point turned it on and never really bothered to switch it back. Yet.

this^

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
On my first playthrough I just walked everywhere. Now when I play I find my self mostly sprinting but I prefer being able to slow down and walk by letting go of a key when I want.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Paz_Ortega_Andrade
item.description:
I like to walk around, look at things, explore and study the environment. Running is useful when you actually have to run somewhere or from someone. Aside from those situations you walk. Seems logical

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: Parnifia
item.description:
HL2, always. For the brief period when I played the original HL, the “always run” just bugged me, especially during Blast Pit. Around the Tentacles, I always held down crouch and walk, which was agonizingly slow but very safe.
…Except for the damn ladders. But that’s neither here nor there.

Read full topic
item.source: Always run, what do you prefer?

item.description:
I for one love the HL1 style. I can actually move around in combat without having to hold down an extra specific key.

I just wish you could walk (using the sprint key with it just isn’t slow enough) like the original.

Read full topic

item.title: Always run, what do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
I prefer the slower HL2 style of movement really, the super fast walk speed in HL1 was a by product of other games at the time like Quake and Unreal.
